title: CLAUDE.md
text:
This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.


This is a personal academic website for Dr. Edmond Kwan, built using Quarto. The site showcases research, publications, presentations, and professional information for a genitourinary cancer medical oncologist and research scientist.



Render the entire website:
quarto render
Preview the website locally:
quarto preview
Render a single page:
quarto render index.qmd
# or
quarto render publications.qmd




Source files (.qmd): Main content files in the root directory

index.qmd - About/home page
research.qmd - Research interests, grants, committees
publications.qmd - Selected publications with images
presentations.qmd - Embedded videos and presentation links
cv-archive.qmd - CV archive page

Images: images/ - Source images directory in root

Quarto automatically copies these to docs/images/ during render
IMPORTANT: Always add new images to images/ (root), NOT docs/images/
Reference in .qmd files as: ![](images/filename.png)

Configuration: _quarto.yml - Site-wide settings, navigation, theme (flatly), and output directory (docs/)
Styling: styles.css - Custom CSS for rounded images, publication formatting, icon lists, and typography
Output: docs/ - Rendered HTML output (this is what gets published to GitHub Pages)

docs/images/ - Auto-generated copy of images/ during render (DO NOT edit directly)

Extensions: _extensions/ - Quarto extensions for FontAwesome and Academicons icons

fontawesome/ - Font Awesome icons (e.g., )
schochastics/academicons/ - Academic icons (e.g., )





Grid Layout System: Pages use Quarto’s grid system extensively:
:::: {.grid}
::: {.g-col-3}
[Left column content - typically images]
:::
::: {.g-col-8}
[Right column content - typically text]
:::
::::
Custom CSS Classes: - .roundedimg - Circular profile images - .publication-title - Styled red publication titles - .publication-author - Smaller author text - .icon-list - Icon + link combinations
Icon Usage: The site uses two icon extension systems. Use the appropriate shortcode syntax: - FontAwesome:  - Academicons: 




Output directory is docs/ (configured for GitHub Pages)
Theme is “flatly” (can be changed in _quarto.yml)
Table of contents is disabled globally (toc: false)
Images: Source images are in root images/ directory - Quarto copies them to docs/images/ during render
PDFs: Store in docs/pdfs/ (if needed in future)
The .nojekyll file prevents GitHub from processing the site with Jekyll




When adding new publication or profile images: 1. Add image file to images/ directory (in root, not in docs/) 2. Reference in .qmd files as: ![](images/filename.png) 3. Run quarto render - Quarto will automatically copy to docs/images/ 4. Commit both images/filename.png AND docs/images/filename.png

title: Edmond Kwan MBBS PhD FRACP
text:
Laboratory Head & Senior Research Fellow
Monash University, Melbourne, Australia
Genitourinary Cancer Medical Oncologist
Eastern Health, Melbourne, Australia

 Google Scholar


 Twitter / X


 ORCID


 Pubmed


 Curriculum vitae


 Contact me





I am a clinician-scientist and genitourinary cancer medical oncologist at Eastern Health in Melbourne, Australia. I currently serve as Laboratory Head and Senior Research Fellow at Eastern Health Clinical School, Monash University, with a cross-appointment within the Biomedicine Discovery Institute Prostate Cancer Research Group.
After completing my specialist training, I pursued a PhD at Monash University, focusing on prostate cancer genomics. I then relocated to Vancouver, Canada, where I completed a genitourinary clinical fellowship at BC Cancer and a postdoctoral fellowship at the Vancouver Prostate Centre, University of British Columbia. My postdoctoral research centered on developing tissue and circulating tumour DNA biomarkers to predict treatment outcomes in lethal metastatic prostate cancer, using samples collected from prospective clinical trials and large biobanks to explore disease biology and tumour evolution. In October 2024, I returned to Australia to begin my independent research career.
My research interests encompass diverse disciplines, including molecular biology, bioinformatics, clinical trials, biobanking, clinical database development, and translational medicine. By combining expertise in cancer genomics and clinical oncology, my research team strives to understand how genomic and epigenomic alterations identified in both tumour tissue and blood can better guide therapeutic decision-making in patients with urological cancers.

title: Edmond Kwan MBBS PhD FRACP
text:

After completing my specialist training, I pursued a PhD at Monash University, focusing on prostate cancer genomics. I then relocated to Vancouver, Canada, where I completed a genitourinary clinical fellowship at BC Cancer and a postdoctoral fellowship at the Vancouver Prostate Centre, University of British Columbia. My postdoctoral research centered on developing tissue and circulating tumour DNA biomarkers to predict treatment outcomes in lethal metastatic prostate cancer, using samples collected from prospective clinical trials and large biobanks to explore disease biology and tumour evolution. In October 2024, I returned to Australia to begin my independent research career.
My research interests encompass diverse disciplines, including molecular biology, bioinformatics, clinical trials, biobanking, clinical database development, and translational medicine. By combining expertise in cancer genomics and clinical oncology, my research team strives to understand how genomic and epigenomic alterations identified in both tumour tissue and blood can better guide therapeutic decision-making in patients with urological cancers.
